marketNews.title: US Inflation Meets Estimates, Interest Rate Cut Expectations Increase
marketNews.content:
Consumer price index inflation in the US in November 2024 rose to 2.7% YoY and 0.3% MoM (
vs. October 2024: inflation 2.6% YoY and 0.2% MoM), moving away from The Fed's target of 2% inflation and marking the highest monthly inflation in 7 months. Nevertheless, annual and monthly inflation were both in line with consensus expectations.

Following the inflation data release, the market became more optimistic about the prospect of a Fed interest rate cut at the December 2024 meeting, which will be held next week. Based on analysis from the CME Fedwatch Tool, the probability of a 25 bps US interest rate cut at the December 2024 meeting increased from 73.8% on Wednesday (4/12) to 98.6% as of Thursday (12/12). Meanwhile, the probability of a Fed interest rate cut of 	â‰¥75 bps until June 2025 decreased from 53.5% on Wednesday (4/12) to 48.1% on Thursday (12/12).

On Wednesday (11/12), the movement of the US stock market tended to be mixed with Nasdaq rising +1.77%, S&P500 strengthening +0.82%, and DJIA correcting -0.22%. Meanwhile, the 10-year US government bond yield rose +4 bps to 4.27% and the US dollar index (DXY) rose +0.29% to 106.71.

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway
marketNews.content: Although the prospect of a Fed interest rate cut at the December 2024 meeting has increased, pressure on the rupiah exchange rate due to the strengthening US dollar risks limiting the room for Bank Indonesia to follow The Fed in lowering interest rates. Bank Indonesia itself said that it is ready to intervene in the currency market to stabilize the rupiah, which is currently slightly below the psychological level of 16,000 per US dollar.

marketNews.title: International Energy Agency (IEA) Projects Global Crude Oil Supply Will Still Be in Surplus
marketNews.content: International Energy Agency (IEA) projected that global crude oil supply will still be in surplus by 1.4 million barrels per day if OPEC+ resumes its production in April 2025. Even if OPEC+ cancels its production recovery, the global crude oil supply will still be in surplus by 950,000 barrels per day. IEA projects global oil consumption will grow by 1.1 million barrels per day in 2025, or an increase of +1% YoY to 103.9 million barrels per day. However, IEA projects that supply outside OPEC+ will increase about +36% more, led by the US, Brazil, Canada, and Guyana.

marketNews.title: BYD's Wholesale Car Sales Increased in November 2024
marketNews.content: Gaikindo noted that BYD's car wholesale sales in November 2024 rose +14% MoM to 2,842 units, causing BYD's market share to increase to 3.8% (vs. October 2024: 3.2%). Cumulatively during 11M24, BYD's car wholesale sales reached 13,866 units, with a market share of 1.8% (vs. 10M24: 1.6%).

marketNews.title: Government to Change Fuel Subsidy Scheme in 2025
marketNews.content: Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources, Bahlil Lahadalia, said that the government ensures it will change the fuel oil (BBM) subsidy scheme in 2025, although he did not elaborate further. Previously, Bahlil stated that the scheme for providing fuel subsidies would be carried out in a blended manner, namely through direct cash assistance (BLT) and quotas based on the commodity.

marketNews.title: Apple Commits to 1 Billion USD Investment in Indonesia in 2026
marketNews.content: Minister of Investment and Downstreaming, Rosan Roeslani, claimed that Apple Inc. (Nasdaq: AAPL) has committed to investing 1 billion US dollars in Indonesia in 2026.

marketNews.title: Pefindo Projects Corporate Debt Issuance in 2025 Between IDR 139-155 Trillion
marketNews.content: Pefindo President Director, Irmawati Amran, said that SOEs project corporate debt issuance during 2025 to range between 139-155 trillion rupiah (vs. 2024 estimate: 146-151 trillion rupiah), driven by refinancing needs, strengthening real sector activity, and lower benchmark interest rates. Next year, the value of maturing bonds is expected to reach 150-156.7 trillion rupiah. According to Pefindo economist, Suhindarto, corporate bond coupons in 2025 will follow the yield of 10-year government bonds, which is expected to range from 6.31-6.69%, lower than 2024's range of 6.65-7.2%.

marketNews.title: Ministers Propose 3 Million Houses Per Year Program for Low-Income Communities (MBR) to Become a National Strategic Program (PSN)
marketNews.content: Minister of Housing and Settlement Areas, Maruarar Sirait, and Minister of Agrarian Affairs and Spatial Planning/Head of the National Land Agency, Nusron Wahid, proposed a program of 3 million houses per year for low-income communities (MBR) to become a national strategic program (PSN). Maruarar said that this proposal considers that the budget of 5 trillion rupiah from the 2025 State Budget can only build about 225,000 homes. Responding to this proposal, the Deputy Chairman of the DPP Real Estate Indonesia, Bambang Ekajaya, said that including the 3 million houses per year program in the PSN could ease the process and secure priority funding from the government.

marketNews.title: Potential for Nuclear Power Plant Locations Identified
marketNews.content: National Energy Council member, Agus Puji Prasetyono, stated that there are 29 locations with the potential to be developed as nuclear power plant (PLTN) facilities. Of these, the first stage of development will focus on 4 locations, namely West Kalimantan, Bangka Belitung, Southeast Sulawesi, and North Maluku. Agus mentioned that one consideration for building PLTNs in these 4 locations is their proximity to mining sites or smelters. According to calculations made by the National Energy Council, Indonesia will gain an additional electricity supply of about 45-54 GW if 29 PLTNs are operational. The government targets the first PLTN to be operational by 2032 with a target capacity of 250 MW.

marketNews.title: FIFA Announced Hosts for 2030 and 2034 World Cups
marketNews.content: FIFA announced on Wednesday (11/12) that Spain, Portugal, and Morocco will be the joint hosts for the 2030 World Cup, while the 2034 World Cup will be held in Saudi Arabia.

tickerNews.title: EMTK Purchases 100 Million SCMA Shares
tickerNews.content: SCMA: The controller of Surya Citra Media, Elang Mahkota Teknologi (EMTK), purchased 100 million SCMA shares at a price of 180 rupiah per share on December 11, 2024. The total transaction value reached 18 billion rupiah. After this transaction, EMTK's ownership in SCMA increased from 61.18% to 61.32%. This transaction marks the 3rd purchase of SCMA shares by EMTK within the last week, following the purchase of 87 million (0.12%) shares on 4-5 December 2024 and 68 million (0.09%) shares on 6-9 December 2024.

tickerNews.title: ASII's November 2024 Car Wholesale Sales Declined
tickerNews.content: ASII: Astra International recorded domestic car wholesale sales of 39,408 units (-17% YoY, -10% MoM) in November 2024, worse than the auto industry's wholesale growth (-12% YoY, -4% MoM), causing ASII's market share to drop to 53% in November 2024 (vs. November 2023: 56%, October 2024: 56.5%). The weakening of ASII's car wholesale was mainly pressured by the decline in Daihatsu sales to 10,030 units (-26% YoY, -29% MoM), while Toyota+Lexus sales were slightly better at 27,183 units (-12.7% YoY, -0.1% MoM). For 11M24, ASII's car wholesale sales decreased by -14% YoY to 440,806 units, with a market share of 56.2% (vs. 11M23: 55.7%).

tickerNews.title: EXCL Confirms No Employee Layoffs Following Merger with FREN
tickerNews.content: EXCL: XL Axiata clarified to the IDX that EXCL and Smartfren Telecom (FREN) do not plan to lay off employees due to the merger plan. EXCL stated that all employees will become employees of the merged company. EXCL also stated that the existing working conditions for all employees are fully guaranteed and will remain unchanged during the transition to, and as part of, the merged company. EXCL's clarification follows a mass leave action taken by EXCL employees, where the EXCL labor union demands transparency in the merger process between EXCL and FREN. EXCL stated that the mass leave action did not impact the company's operational activities.

tickerNews.title: BUMI Targets USD 5.5-6 Billion Revenue in 2025 with Coal Production Volume of 78-80 Million Tons
tickerNews.content: BUMI: Bumi Resources Director and Corporate Secretary, Dileep Srivastava, stated that the company targets revenues of US$5.5-6 billion during 2025, with a target production volume of around 78-80 million tons and an expected price higher than 2024. BUMI Director, Maringan M. Ido Hotna Hutabarat, stated that the company has obtained government approval to produce 80 million tons of coal during 2025, detailed as 55 million tons from PT Kaltim Prima Coal with an average GAR of 5,000 and 25 million tons from PT Arutmin Indonesia with an average GAR of 4,400. BUMI Director, Sri Dharmayanti, mentioned that they cannot confirm exactly when this quasi-reorganization action can be realized, but she mentioned that BUMI is striving to be able to distribute dividends after the quasi-reorganization is completed.

tickerNews.title: SRAJ Plans to Issue 125 Million USD Debt to Bain Capital Credit LP Entities
tickerNews.content: SRAJ: Sejahteraraya Anugrahjaya plans to issue debt instruments worth 125 million US dollars with a 7-year tenor to entities owned by Bain Capital Credit LP. The value of the debt instruments is equivalent to 101.61% of SRAJ's equity as of September 2024, with the proceeds intended to support working capital and business development through the expansion of Mayapada Hospital South Jakarta and the construction of new hospitals, such as Mayapada Apollo Batam International Hospital in Batam and Mayapada Hospital Surabaya 2. This plan will be discussed at the EGM on January 20, 2025. This plan is part of Bain Capital Credit's $157 million investment in SRAJ, marking the first investment made by the US investment firm in Indonesia. In addition to the debt instrument, Bain Capital Credit through its business entity also conducted a new share subscription in SRAJ worth 32 million US dollars.

tickerNews.title: PTPP Recorded New Contract Value of ~IDR 26.2 Trillion in 11M24
tickerNews.content: PTPP: PT PP recorded a new contract value of ~26.2 trillion rupiah (-13.4% YoY) during 11M24, equivalent to 81.7% of the 2024 target of 32 trillion rupiah.

tickerNews.title: LABA Signed MOU for Electricity Purchase with Timor Leste Government Institution
tickerNews.content: LABA: Green Power Group announced that it has signed a memorandum of understanding for electricity purchase and sale with a government institution in Oecusse, Timor Leste. The memorandum of understanding also includes LABA's cooperation plan with a local company to develop a solar power plant (PLTS) facility with a capacity of 5 MW and a battery energy storage system.

tickerNews.title: JAWA Plans to Sign Debt of ~IDR 1.3 Trillion from Controller, Discussed in EGM on December 13, 2024
tickerNews.content: JAWA: Jaya Agra Wattie plans to sign a debt of ~1.3 trillion rupiah from its controller, PT Sarana Agro Investama, which is planned to be provided gradually according to demand. The value of the planned loan is equivalent to 227.5% of the company's book equity as of June 30, 2024. The loan is interest-free, thus not burdening the company's finances. JAWA stated that by implementing this loan plan, the company will obtain funds for interest-bearing debt payments to the syndicate bank and finance its operational activities. This plan will be discussed at the EGM on December 13, 2024.

tickerNews.title: MNC Kapital Indonesia (BCAP) Plans to Issue Bonds Up to IDR 500 Billion
tickerNews.content: BCAP: MNC Kapital Indonesia plans to issue bonds up to 500 billion rupiah, with proceeds intended for refinancing previous bonds and company working capital. The bonds consist of Series A (370-day tenor), Series B (3-year tenor), and Series C (5-year tenor), with interest rates yet to be announced. The public offering schedule is from January 2 to 7, 2025. These bonds have received an idBBB+ rating from Pefindo.
